alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Volusia County through 745 PM EDT... At 725 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Apollo Beach, or over Oak Hill, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oak Hill, Apollo Beach, Bethune Beach, Turtle Mound and Eldora. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
